availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, stonemason and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Deringer. Father of Catharine Deringer, Mary E. Deringer, Ann Deringer, William Deringer Parellee Deringer, and James Deringer. Stonemason in Washington County in 1860. Farmer in Washington County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Mackville, District 1, p. 66. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Washington County, KY, 1863, p. 50, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Mackville, p. 5. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Pleasureville, p. 2.
